timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.message: feat(e2e-tests): Add E2E tests for relationship APIs
feat(e2e-tests): Add E2E tests for relationship APIs
feat(e2e-tests): Add E2E tests for relationship APIs

timeline.bodyText: Could this be split out into a separate test?
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I thought about that, but that would require that we create the model and twins again. Since they were already available as a part of this lifecycle test, I added this assertion in here directly.
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Is this missing some code to test updating the relationship?
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: no, same comment as added in the sync client test
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Could this be split out into a separate test? This test is already quite long
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I can split it into a separate test if you feel strongly about it; I added it in here because of the convenience (the models are twins were already created).
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Like in the sync client test, are you missing code here?
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: No, the update operation is in the line right below this comment. Is the additional spacing confusing? Or is it because of the comment "Create relationship from Floor -> Room"?
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: don't we need it everywhere in this file?
timeline.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: the required non-null check? I added it here because intellij recommended that I do; we should go through our code to see if it makes sense to add it  elsewhere as well.
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Should we just call it RelationshipsAsyncTest? do we need the DigitalTwin prefix?
timeline.author: azabbasi
